definition[0]: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time
example[0]: They grabbed each otherâ€™s hands in simultaneous panic.
example[1]: Up to twenty users can have simultaneous access to the system.
example[2]: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation  (=immediate translation, as the person is speaking) into English.
example[3]: The withdrawal of British troops should be simultaneous with that of US forces.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people often say that two things happen at the same time, rather than say that they are simultaneous:
example[4]: Up to twenty people can use the system at the same time.
